private_information: I am the left peg and I hold the full stack of 8 disks from top to bottom: A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H
Only the top disk (A) is movable from this peg at the start
left_peg.goal: Move the entire stack of disks to the right peg following Tower of Hanoi rules.

private_information: I am the middle peg and I am initially empty
I can temporarily hold disks but cannot support placing a larger disk on a smaller one
middle_peg.goal: Assist in moving disks so that the entire stack ends on the right peg.

private_information: I am the right peg and I am initially empty
My goal is to receive the full stack in correct order from top to bottom A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H
right_peg.goal: Receive the entire stack of disks in order A (top) to H (bottom).

private_information: I coordinate information from the peg agents and produce the final PDDL domain and problem
orchestrator.goal: Produce a complete PDDL domain and problem encoding the 8-disk Tower of Hanoi on pegs left, middle, right suitable for FastDownwards and achieving the goal configuration.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 8 disks labeled A (smallest) through H (largest).
Only one disk may be moved at a time and a larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has disks top to bottom A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H; middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: right peg has disks top to bottom A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H; left and middle pegs are empty.

proposal.system_prompt: You are the left peg agent. You know the local stack and the legal operations from your peg. Provide a concise description of the top disk, the legal single-disk moves you can perform, and any local constraints or observations. Do not emit PDDL.
proposal.prompt: Your name is left_peg. Public information: {environment->public_information} Your private information: {agents->left_peg->private_information} Global goal: {agents->left_peg->goal} Describe legal moves from this peg and any constraints relevant to planning the moves.

proposal.system_prompt: You are the middle peg agent. You know your local state and the legal operations for moving single disks to or from your peg. Provide a concise description of possible moves involving this peg and any constraints you see. Do not emit PDDL.
proposal.prompt: Your name is middle_peg. Public information: {environment->public_information} Your private information: {agents->middle_peg->private_information} Global goal: {agents->middle_peg->goal} Describe legal moves involving this peg and any constraints relevant to planning the moves.

proposal.system_prompt: You are the right peg agent. You know your local state and the legal operations for receiving disks. Provide a concise description of moves your peg can accept and any constraints or ordering observations. Do not emit PDDL.
proposal.prompt: Your name is right_peg. Public information: {environment->public_information} Your private information: {agents->right_peg->private_information} Global goal: {agents->right_peg->goal} Describe legal moves to this peg and any constraints relevant to planning the moves.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Collect the peg agents' proposals and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem encoding the Tower of Hanoi instance with 8 disks and three pegs named left, middle, right. The PDDL must model single-disk moves and the constraint that a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk. Target the Fast Downward planner (FastDownwards). Provide a domain and a problem; enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. You will receive the peg agents' descriptions of legal moves and local constraints: {proposal_left} {proposal_middle} {proposal_right} Use this information and the public environment description {environment->public_information} to produce a single cohesive PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that models the initial and goal states for the 8-disk Tower of Hanoi. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>.
